fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8418].
  {panel}

If a user:
 - does not check "Remember me"
 - fills in the issue creation form
 - leaves the computer for an hour
 - returns to the computer and clicks 'Submit'

then they are likely to get a confusing permission error, because they are not logged in anymore. If anonymous issue submission is allowed, the issue may be submitted anonymously, which is not what is wanted.

Ideally JIRA would detect that the session is expired, save the current form data (in a new session's attribute), redirect them to the login page and return to CreateIssueDetails.jspa without losing any of the previously entered data.
fields.summary: Permission errors when session times out halfway through creating an issue

fields.description:
When generating ids for new database records OfBiz Entity Engine (database communication layer that JIRA uses) issues a SELECT SQL statement on a db connection after a transaction has been committed.

After issuing the SELECT statement, OfBiz returns the connection back to the database connection pool, but without committing a transaction (i.e. without calling comit() on the connection). This is OK as there is no transaction in progress. WebSphere complains about this with the following exception:

{code}
[11/2/05 22:32:57:330 CST] 5a310270 LocalTranCoor E WLTC0032E: One or more resources rolled back. An unresolved LocalTransactionContainment had an unresolved action of rollback.
                                                                                                                                                          
[11/2/05 22:32:57:330 CST] 5a310270 WebAppTransac E WTRN0043I: LocalTransaction rolled-back due to setRollbackOnly.
                                                                                                                                                          
[11/2/05 22:32:57:363 CST] 5a310270 WebGroup      E SRVE0026E: [Servlet Error]-[LocalTransaction rolled-back due to setRollbackOnly]: com.ibm.ws.LocalTransaction.RolledbackException
        at com.ibm.ws.LocalTransaction.LocalTranCoordImpl.cleanup(LocalTranCoordImpl.java(Compiled Code))
        at com.ibm.ws.webcontainer.webapp.WebAppTransactionCollaborator.postInvoke(WebAppTransactionCollaborator.java(Compiled Code))
        at com.ibm.ws.webcontainer.webapp.WebAppRequestDispatcher.dispatch(WebAppRequestDispatcher.java(Compiled Code))
        at com.ibm.ws.webcontainer.webapp.WebAppRequestDispatcher.forward(WebAppRequestDispatcher.java(Compiled Code))
        at com.ibm.ws.webcontainer.srt.WebAppInvoker.doForward(WebAppInvoker.java(Compiled Code))
        at com.ibm.ws.webcontainer.srt.WebAppInvoker.handleInvocationHook(WebAppInvoker.java(Compiled Code))
        at com.ibm.ws.webcontainer.cache.invocation.CachedInvocation.handleInvocation(CachedInvocation.java(Compiled Code))
        at com.ibm.ws.webcontainer.srp.ServletRequestProcessor.dispatchByURI(ServletRequestProcessor.java(Compiled Code))
        at com.ibm.ws.webcontainer.oselistener.OSEListenerDispatcher.service(OSEListener.java(Compiled Code))
        at com.ibm.ws.webcontainer.http.HttpConnection.handleRequest(HttpConnection.java(Compiled Code))
        at com.ibm.ws.http.HttpConnection.readAndHandleRequest(HttpConnection.java(Compiled Code))
        at com.ibm.ws.http.HttpConnection.run(HttpConnection.java(Compiled Code))
        at com.ibm.ws.util.ThreadPool$Worker.run(ThreadPool.java:593)
{code}

Fixed by doing a SELECT in its own transaction and keeping WebSphere very happy.
fields.summary: Generating ids for database records causes WebSphere to report error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-8413].
  {panel}

Our project is in the process of evaluating JIRA (BTW: Great product) and have a question about if the following is possible.

Is it possible to create a group of fields on an issue that are repeatable? I'm looking at a screen with 5 or 6 different fields on it and a user can fill in the fields, click add and add more if needed. Probably the best example within Jira I see of this is the View Screen Schemes page where you can add as many schemes as you want. Is it possible to add such functionality for an issue?

I don't think this is possible OOB and will require custom code, but wanted to ask the JIRA community about it.

Thanks
-Jeff

fields.description:
When using the "Attach screenshot" functionality to attach a screenshot created in a Citrix session, the shot gets cut into two halfs that gets "glued" together wrong. See attached screenshot.

The problem can be replicated the following way.

1. Run JIRA on your local machine
2. Create a Citrix seesion (or a remote desktop) to another machine
3. Press PrtScr in your Citrix session (or the remote desktop session) - this will transfer the screenshot to your local clipboard
4. Run the "Attach screenshot" applet and paste the clipboard into it

... the screenshot will look like the attached one.
fields.summary: Pasting content from a clipboard via Citrix looks funny

fields.description:
Given a list of filter results, one thing you might want to do is view the highest priority items.  So, you click the priority column header and what do you see?  The lowest priority items get sorted to the top.  This would seem to be never what a user would want to do.

I always end up having to click twice on the priority header to get the view that I'm wanting.  It would be nice if I could do away with that extra click.
fields.summary: Initial priority sorting direction is no the one you want

fields.description: I always want to be emailed notifications for any events that happen during the lifecycle of my issues , except if I made the change. To support this, I would like to see an improvement to the "Add New Notification" page. I would like to see a new checkbox called "Exclude current user" at the bottom of the page, or next to each relevant recipient type. If I select the "Current Assignee" radio option and check the new "Exclude current user" checkbox, I expect that I will be emailed if I am the current assignee, except if I was the user who made the change. I could imagine using this checkbox for the "Current Assignee", "Reporter", "Project Lead", "Single User", "Group" and "All Watchers" recipient types.
fields.summary: Add "Exclude current user" checkbox to the "Add New Notification" page

Regarding JRA-7403 - can we please make trackback sending configurable per project?

fields.description:
Currently the preset filters are hard-coded. While this works fine in most common setups, it doesn't work when the usage of fields like "resolution" changes or in some custom workflows. The only way to get around this problem is to the edit the JSPs {{/includes/panels/filters_firsthalf.jsp}} and {{/includes/panels/filters_secondhalf.jsp}} with the new query. This is not really ideal.

You should be able to use a saved global filter as a preset filter. The filter will then have it's project property replaced for each project (similar to what gets done with the portlet stats) so the the filter is relevent for each project. The users then have full flexibility to change the filters for their own system.

The obvious follow-up improvement on top of this is to make this configurable per project.

This will mean, however, that the current present filters will need to be added in as built in saved filters (which might not be a bad thing), with probably the first created user as the owner. Else we need to allow saved filters with no author and allow other users to delete that filter as required.
fields.summary: Allow Global saved filters to be used as a preset filter on the Browse Project page

fields.description:
Custom fields are still searchable even if they are hidden in field configuration. It sill display if the field is in context. This should work similarly to other systems fields where it's not shown if it's hidden in all currently relevent Field Configurations.

This can lead to the *mis-conception* that hidden fields can be a useful way to have read only custom fields (see JRA-8344). You should use screens to achieve the same effects instead.

(1) Time Tracking is configured as follows:
Time Tracking is currently ON.
The number of working hours per day is 8.
The number of working days per week is 5.

(2) Attachment Sub-Task_REQ-109_WorkLog shows the entire work log of a sub-task
Bsaed on our time tracking config the time spent is calculated correctly in the view
issue details screen: 28 hours > 3 days, 4 hours

(3) When the same sub-task (REQ-109), however, appears in a list in the issue navigator,
the time spent is not calculated based on the time tracking config (see attachment
Sub-Task_REQ-109_IssueNavigator). 24 working hours per day are used instead of 8. 
Therefore, 28 hours > 1 day, 4 hours

I reckon that this is a bug. I expect that the time tracking configuration is taken into 
account throughout the system when sum totals of logged working hours are calculated.
Please advise!

Cheers,
Claudia

fields.description:
The problem is that Sybase refuses to store empty strings and stores spaces instead:
[http://manuals.sybase.com/onlinebooks/group-as/asg1250e/sqlug/@Generic__BookTextView/2485]

The reason they provide for this is that an empty value means NULL and as "" is not NULL they have to store a space. Fascinating logic, every other db we support, which is quite a few, seems to deal with it fine.

fields.description:
Since 3.3.3 (JRA-8080) JIRA returns all details of all schemes for the getProject method call. This means that *all* information of *all* schemes for all projects iin JIRA is returned in this method call. While this may be desirable in some instances, it leads to unneccessarily large XML responses in other cases.

There should be a {{getProjectsNoSchemes}} method that will mimic the old behaviour

fields.description:
When selecting the Assignee of an Issue, Jira displays a list of all Jira users, which can be cumbersome to use, especially if the list of users is longer than 100 names. In addition, the top section of the dropdown list shows the reporter:
 		Unassigned
		-Automatic-
		Andy Reporter
		-----------
		Aaron Notinproject
		(rest of the names)

but the "active" selection is on the current assignee, which may be way down the list, so the top portion is off the screen. As a result, the reporter's name (Andy Reporter) is not in the main body of the list where expected, and this can be confusing when the Reporter is the person to be assigned the issue.. 

The current proposal is to place a "hot" list consisting of the reporter, together with all users that have been assigned an issue in the current project at the top of the list:

			Unassigned
			- Automatic -
			Adam Ispossibleassinee
			Andy Reporter
			Bill Anothername
			Ernest Currentassignee 
			Jim Canbeassigned
			Xavier Beenassignee
			----------------------
			Aaron Notinproject
			Amy Assignedtootherteam
			... (rest of names) 


This listing would have a good probability of listing the name of the intended assignee at the top of the list, and thus be more efficient to use. In addition, the cursor would be in the "hot" list (because the current assignee would be in the top section), so it would be natural to check the hot list first, and then check the larger list below, if necessary.
fields.summary: Streamlining the selection of the Issue Assignee

fields.description:
+what I have done+:
# specifiy a field as "required" within the field configuration, e.g. time estimations (German: "Zeiterfassung", see marks within the attachments)
# modify the default screen *not* to contain this field as it will be part of a different screen, attached to a workflow transition
# create a new issue by filling out the default screen

+result+:
this will create an error message, saying that the required field has not been entered ( although it is not visible on the screen and cannot be entered at all ! ) as shown on the attached screen shot

+consequence+:
It is not possible to create any new issue !
That's very hard to detect, if you are not aware of the system behaviour and will generate a huge amount of internal support calls by the effected users.

fields.description:
When the Workflow Current Step Integrity Checker encounters an Issue that has an invalid status (another issue) it dies with a Null pointer.
An issue can have an invalid status (one that does not exist for the workflow) if a Workflow Migration or Bulk Move died half way through.


{panel:title=Solution/Work around| borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
This problem can be noticed when browsing/searching for issues, but finding the problematic issue often happens in the integrity checker
* After running the integrity checker you should have the issue ID of the problematic issue
* Go to that issue to view it
* Clone it: (More actions > Clone)
* Delete it: (More actions > Delete)

(!) Note that comments are lost during the cloning operation.
{panel}
fields.summary: Workflow Current Step Integrity Check dies when an issue has an invalid status
Bring release plan doc up to speed

fields.description:
Currently the regular expression defining valid project keys is defined in WEB-INF/classes/jira-application.properties:

jira.projectkey.pattern = ([A-Z][A-Z]+)

Since:

 - once edited, data won't work properly in JIRA instances with the default regexp

we should store this regexp in the database, and make it editable through the web interface.

fields.description:
Would like the ability to use a series of canned responses when commenting on or resolving a ticket. When selected these responses would be placed into the edit box and could then changed before submitting.

Would save a heap of time when responding to customers.

An example might be...
"The issue you have reported appears to be a bug. This issue will require development to resolve. A ticket has been created in the development queue, when developed the issue will be provided to you in the form of an update.

You can track progress on the bug by going to..."
fields.summary: Canned responses

fields.description:
For emails that have a format where reply and quoted message have some arbitrary "divider", I have implemented a flexible regex-based comment handler.

Given a regex pattern for the divider, it will split the email body, returning only the first part as the comment.

If the pattern is not found, it returns the email body unchanged
If the regex is not specified, it returns the email body unchanged
If there is any error (ie regex expression error), it returns the email body unchanged
(See the tests for more details)

Our immediate need is to clean the junk out of emails that Lotus Notes puts there. None of the existing handlers do anything close to what needs to be done.

If  you could merge it into the next release, that would be grand.

-Nick

(see attached Handler + test)
fields.summary: Regex Comment Handler for Mail Fetching Service
